prompt: Facts: Case concerns appeal against High Court judgment convicting the accused-appellant Ramdev Singh under Section 302 IPC, reversing the Trial Court's acquittal.; Incident occurred on the night between 20.05.1991 and 21.05.1991 in Village Tungwali, District Bhatinda.; Accused Ramdev Singh, along with Bhola Singh (armed with gandasa, proclaimed offender) and Bira Singh (armed with sela/spear, died during trial), allegedly came near the house of Gurjant Singh (PW-4).; Ramdev Singh was armed with a .12 bore gun.; The accused party challenged Gurdeep Singh (deceased).; Ramdev Singh fired his gun, hitting Gurdeep Singh in the chest.; Gurdeep Singh fell down and subsequently died.; The incident was witnessed by Gurmail Singh (PW-3, brother of the deceased) and Gurjant Singh (PW-4, friend of the deceased).; PW-3 took Gurdeep Singh to Civil Hospital, Bhatinda, where he was declared dead.; First Information Report (FIR) was lodged by PW-3.; Post-mortem examination confirmed death due to gunshot injury described as sufficient to cause death in the ordinary course of nature.; The .12 bore gun was recovered pursuant to a disclosure statement made by Ramdev Singh.; Trial Court acquitted Ramdev Singh, citing discrepancies in witness statements, relationship of PW-3 to the deceased, and delay in lodging the FIR.; Punjab & Haryana High Court, on appeal by the State, set aside the acquittal and convicted Ramdev Singh under Section 302 IPC, sentencing him to life imprisonment.; This appeal before the Supreme Court is filed by Ramdev Singh challenging the High Court's conviction.; Supreme Court observed that PW-3 and PW-4 testimonies were cogent, credible and inspired confidence.; Supreme Court noted that the medical evidence (post-mortem report) fully corroborated the ocular evidence (eyewitness testimonies). | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder), Section 300 (Murder - specifically clause 'Thirdly'), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention - contextually relevant due to co-accused, though conviction was under 302 simpliciter)
